creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: view of a church built into a hill with long stone staircase and two short spires cropped by image frame; a house is also built into the hillside to the front and R of church
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamp

-- inscribed in graphite below platemark, at left: [Trial II #]
-- inscribed in graphite on recto, bottom of sheet: [Dry wipe, no retroussage, state of the plate / wt / c]
-- in graphite on recto, upper right corner: F409
-- in graphite on mount: [Estaing (Aveyron)] | [2 12/16 x 2 7 16] | A 420 | F 409 | 
-- in graphite on front of mat: #40 | 175
markings: stamp on recto, bottom of sheet: Collection-E John Taylor Arms, not in Lugt
provenance: Collection of the artist (not in Lugt). John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed and dated in graphite, below platemark, at right: [John Taylor Arms 1947]
title: Estaing (Aveyron), From French Church Series
